intro: Coluteastrum capense, commonly known as the Cape colutea, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Leguminosae, also known as the legume or bean family. The plant is characterized by its small, yellow flowers and trifoliate leaves, which are typical of many legumes. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils. The plant is also notable for its ability to fix nitrogen, contributing to soil fertility.
